history.text: Hey, do you feel like talking about The Wolf of Wall Street?
Yeah, I feel like talking about the movie. Let's do this!
I really liked Leo's character in this one, something about him really appealed to me. What about you?
I am obsessed with Margot Robbie. Given her circumstances, she continues to play a major role as the wife and she keeps her head high under any situations. Tell me you have seen that too?

There is also something about Patrick Denham that is credible. As an FBI agent, he is really determined to make his job his business. For instance, he brings the bad guys down which is an awesome thing given the role.
I completely agree with you about Margot Robbie. She's a scene stealer in every movie she's in, and this one is no exception. And Denham has that pull too as the law and order guy.
That's right. What else fascinates you about the movie?
Rob Reiner showing up was a surprise to me, so that was neat as well. I don't remember him being publicized as having a part in this.
You should be prepared for surprises. Right?
I wasn't really sure what to think about this movie before going in. It seemed so narrow in scope, but it really was a big story.
What I love about the movie, in general, is the fact that it is a comedy. You can't stop laughing.
Yeah, it was a big story. It has just be narrowed down for purposes well known by the producers.
But each laugh had such a bitter edge to it. It was funny but made me think twice about the butt of each joke.
Funny. The sad thing is most of the characters they are not as charming as we would have loved to have instead they are dull but still manages to keep our spirits high.
I felt that they didn't need to be charming though. They felt like real people to me. Maybe not anyone I know, but I could imagine them being people I passed on the street.
Yeah, I get the feeling but maybe there is just more I expected from it. You know.
What general aspects that made you watch it?
I get that, and I guess after I get over this initial glow of having just watched the movie, I'll find more to fault in it.
Honestly I only watched it because it's on tv.
Really? That is way too honest.
I missed it when it came out in 2013, but remembered hearing about it, so when I saw it was just starting... Hey, why not?
No, it is not a problem. The name of the movie attracted me to watch it.
Going back to the unexpected aspects of this movie, the whole Switzerland bank thing can be such a cliche, but I wasn't expecting it in this movie.
The whole twist with the British friends did add something to it though.
Which made it beautiful.
Though the scene is not a one time thing. Like there is this part of two years later where the FBI arrested Jordan
Do you remember that part?

Also, I kind of thought it would be just about Wall Street traders, but with Margot Robbie in it, it really pulls at the heartstrings when he does get arrested and tries to run off with their daughter.
It's one of those things where you kind of hate him for turning informer, but would you or I have done it any differently? I'm not sure I can tell.

That was a sad thing especially putting an innocent baby in all that confusion at that age. Though somehow I felt that evidence was not worth arresting Jordan. Others look like they were forged just to put a blame on someone.
I would have done the same thing given the same position. Besides that is what he was being paid for.
Yeah, but at least he went on to putting those skills to a good use after he got out.
When Jordan is forced to wear a wire, he made a smart move by writing the note to Donnie warning him so they can watch their back with the situation
I don't know how smart it was, given that he got caught doing it.
But you can't deny the humanity in trying.
Though the system is favourable. It was fascinating for the reduction of the sentence meant for Jordan. Can you imagine the life he would have gone through?
But he was doing it to save someone from more trouble. Really.
No no, I get why he did it, and it obviously worked out. But wow what a risk!
But his release was something awesome and him trying to make friends with the neighbour Donnie Azoff. Somehow he felt lonely making him find friends.
Honestly, I would have tried to tip him off too if Jonah Hill was my friend, lol.
Ooooh really? Probably he doesn't deserve that.
Ha! Anyway, It's been good talking to you. but I've got places to be.

Does this end automatically, or do we hit the "
Finish Conversation" button?
Oooh yeah, that is awesome. Who is submitting it? Are we done yet?
Yeah, I see it though. Should I finish the conversation?
I'm pretty sure we are, I guess I'll just hit the button. Cheers.
Okay bye

uid1response.feedback: I liberally indulged in BS, but the other person seemed cool.

uid2response.feedback: It was a nice chat. Thank you.
